repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Non-Bank Financial Institutions
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. The main lessons address
            the following. Projects of this nature should consider two
            main areas - strengthening of regulatory agencies, and
            improving payment systems - so as to better manage project
            components, and beneficiaries, moreover, limiting the number
            of components, to obtain satisfactory results, as proven by
            this operation. During the mid-term review, project
            performance indicators were redefined, which enabled
            progress monitoring, an issue that needs to be discussed in
            detail with beneficiaries, to ensure the value of
            indicators, and its acceptance. Such well defined indicators
            also insulates the implementation of the project from
            political interference, an issue which could have been
            prevented had the indicators been in place early on.
            Furthermore, procurement of large, and complex information
            technology systems, and equipment needs to be revisited by
            the Bank, in particular, the project could be used as a case
            study towards developing a necessary procurement expertise.
            Procurement delays caused irreparable harm to project
            implementation; ideally, project design should address key
            procurement issues, to improve development impacts. Finally,
            project coordination should be mainstreamed within
            implementing agencies, based on the years of experience with
            the Africa Region's policy, and, policy dialogues
            should remain engaged beyond the immediate component objectives.

TF021070-SWEDISH (SIDA) CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF029154-PHRD-NON-BANK FINANCICAL
            INSTITUTIONS PROJECT
18157109.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rule of law

repnme.cdata!:
Ghana - Non-Bank Financial Institutions
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Non-Bank Financial Institutions
            Assistance Credit Project has two objectives.  The first is
            to promote the growth of an efficient, competitive, well
            regulated, non-bank financial sector and an efficient
            payments system in order to: 1) increase the mobilization of
            domestic savings in both formal and informal sectors; 2)
            facilitate the flow of international capital into Ghana
            through better financial intermediation; and 3) supply
            financial services competitively to the economy.  The second
            objective is to create an environment conducive to greater
            private sector activity and support the successful
            implementation of the divestiture program for state owned
            enterprises (SOE) and the three largest state-owned
            commercial banks.  The project addresses identified gaps in
            the non-bank financial sector including: capital markets
            institutions such as the Ghana Stock Exchange (GSE),
            Securities Regulatory Commission (SRC), and the Bank of
            Ghana (BOG), and contractual savings institutions, such as
            National Insurance Commission (NIC), State Insurance
            Corporation (SIC), Ghana Reinsurance Organization (GRO), and
            Social Security and National Insurance Trust (SSNIT).  The
            project also provides for associated financial
            infrastructure (domestic payments system) and capacity
            building in the non-bank financial institutions sector and
            diagnostic studies at the Ministry of Finance to enable the
            Government of Ghana to prepare strategies for future actions
            in expanding the provision of financial services to rural
            and informal sectors.
